title: SocialNav-SUB: Benchmarking VLMs for Scene Understanding in Social Robot Navigation
summary: This paper focuses on benchmarking Vision-Language Models (VLMs) for scene understanding in social robot navigation, specifically inferring spatial-temporal aspects of complex social navigation scenes. It highlights the need for robust scene understanding in dynamic, human-centered environments.
usefulness_reason: The summary explicitly mentions "inferring the spatial-temporal" aspects of scenes and "benchmarking" which implies the use of a dataset, making it relevant to "Spatio Temporal" and "Contextual dataset".
